meanings.definition: The action or process of calculating or estimating something.
meanings.sent1: Her reckoning of the distance to the park was off by a few blocks.
meanings.sent2: The reckoning of the total cost took longer than expected.
meanings.sent3: After a failed reckoning of the recipe, she ended up with a salty cake.
meanings.sent4: In the reckoning of time, every second counts.
meanings.sent5: His reckoning of the situation was clear and precise.

meanings.definition: A person's view, opinion, or judgment.
meanings.sent1: In his reckoning, the movie was the best he had ever seen.
meanings.sent2: Her reckoning on the matter differed from her friend's.
meanings.sent3: His reckoning on fashion trends was always a topic of discussion.
meanings.sent4: She had a unique reckoning on the concept of love.
meanings.sent5: Their reckoning of the situation was clouded by bias.

meanings.definition: The settlement of accounts or debts.
meanings.sent1: The reckoning of the bills at the end of the month was always stressful.
meanings.sent2: The reckoning with the landlord was finally resolved.
meanings.sent3: Their reckoning with the bank left them with a sense of relief.
meanings.sent4: The reckoning of the company's finances was meticulous.
meanings.sent5: The reckoning of the debt took longer than expected.

meanings.definition: Retribution or punishment for past actions.
meanings.sent1: He knew the reckoning for his actions would come eventually.
meanings.sent2: The reckoning for his betrayal was severe.
meanings.sent3: The reckoning for her mischief was a week of grounding.
meanings.sent4: The reckoning for his crimes was swift and just.
meanings.sent5: The reckoning for their disobedience was a lesson learned.
